title: Eastern TownHall Team Operation
description: 東部時間帯に住んでいて、言語が英語ではない場合、Catalystへの参加は難しい。

f6_assessments.q0: The Eastern Town Hall is operating to attract more people from Eastern Hemisphere. And they have run Eastern Town Hall for quite a bit. I have participated every week in the Eastern Town Hall, it attracts lots of people who cannot attend Global Town Hall due to time differences. And it also provides community leader who can speak in their own native language. So it aligns with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team consists of veteran member in Project Catalyst. The plan is quite good described. Budgeting is reasonable. In my opinion, this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The usage of the budget could be tracked by the community via Financial Report every quarter. The KPI is quite clear also.

f6_assessments.q0: For Catalyst to be effective, it should be popular in all the major geographical zones. So Eastern TownHall is no doubt effective way of communication, I took part in them and think that's a vital thing for Catalyst growth. My only small concern is that it might better fit for "Multilingual resources" category.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan is very detailed, with KPIs, and the team is very experience with proven commitment to the Project Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget is very detailed, and even that I think it could be more modest, it's good that proposers but some discount.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem and the solution make sense and are within the scope of the challenge. The Eastern Town Hall is a communication channel that can engage the community in the eastern hemisphere, for reasons of time zone and different languages, so it's a good way to onboard new people to Catalyst.

The continuity of the Eastern Town Hall and incentives for participation for 6 months are a good indicator of impact, as the community will have a channel to exchange information about Catayst for a reasonable period, which adds to the impact of the proposal on the challenge, however there is a lack of indicators about the engagement of the community in the Eastern Town Hall.

The 20% growth target for each Fund doesn't establish an initial number of participants, 20% growth without a base number of participants is not a good indicator. E.g.

-If the base number is 100 participants and there is a 20% increase for each Fund, there will be more than 140 participants after 2 Funds

-If the base number is 10 participants there would be an increase of only 4 participants after 2 Funds.

My point is, without a base number of participants this indicator is not appropriate for impact indication.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team presented qualifications and experience suitable for the objectives defined in the proposal. The members involved in the proposal have already held sessions for a few weeks and the work is already being developed on a voluntary basis.

The proposal intends to use the funds to create a treasury to fund activities for the maintenance of the Eastern Town Hall like, software costs, subsidies, bounties, management costs, translation and creation of content relevant to Catalyst. 

There is an adequate and reasonable timeline adjusted for the maintenance of the Eastern Town Hall for the next 6 months.

There is a budget breakdown, but establishing a discount for the required amount in the budget doesn't make sense. If the proposal requires X amount of money, asking for only part of the amount only indicates less feasibility and reliability of the defined amounts. If the intention is to lower the subsidy for participation in Town Halls it would make more sense to lower the incentive to less than $15 per person.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is clarity in the problem, solution and alignment with the challenge. 

The established goals are linked to the continuity of the Eastern Town Hall sessions for 6 months, but there is no roadmap with clear milestones. A questionnaire will be used to collect feedback from participants, but it is unclear what information to collect in the questionnaire. The team is committed to report financial data about all expenses of the treasuty.

The success of the proposal was linked to a 20% increase in the number of participants for each Fund, but this is not a reliable indicator as an initial number of participants has not been established.

I would recommend including metrics that allow for a more objective and detailed assessment of the proposal's success. I imagine the 20% increase KPI would be a good indicator if it was tied to an initial number of participants.

f6_assessments.q0: I am a Participant of the Eastern Townhall meetings myself, I am thrilled that this proposal is in the challenge. I greatly appreciate the townhall meetings. They've helped me so much in the early stage of becoming a CA. The proposal accurately represents this challenge. Further developing and maintaining these meetings is crucial for a steady income of CA's. Since the proposers are part of the community you can clearly see that they know how a proposal is supposed to be and it shows. I can't really see any fault for impact.
f6_assessments.q1: Because the Townhall meetings are already present and the proposal's purpose is to maintain the meetings and give structure to the community group leading I find it hard to believe this proposal won't succeed. The fact that the proposal is using references fills my heart with joy. I had fun reading this proposal and it went like a breeze to assess this. I have full confidence that this proposal will be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: Everything needed to assess this on auditability is here, from milestones to KPI's. The budget breakdown is clear and easily assessable. KPI's are defined and match the proposal as they should. Since this proposal is more of a treasury for the community group that is holding the meetings a roadmap is not given since this is not needed. There is only one thing for me to say after reading this proposal "keep up the superb work , you guys make a huge difference"

f6_assessments.q0: a very nice proposal, with alignment to the fund section. There were too many proposals during F6 which are trying to improve and decrease the language barrier and is nice to see a project, which is already running in this matte
f6_assessments.q2:
The key metrics are the percentual increase over funds as a result of the proposal. 

It would be nice to see some historical statistics.

f6_assessments.q0:
Yes. A well-thought-out proposal that takes an innovative approach to supporting the important onboarding work that this team is already successfully doing. A treasury, managed by them,  enables them to respond quickly to the onboarding needs of their communities, and to take an integrated approach rather than trying to tackle different aspects of the challenge in isolation. And the fact that they see the proposal as a way to "pioneer and prototype DAO treasury management reporting" means the proposal could lead to important learning for the wider Catalyst community too.
It's also positive that the project is led by people from its target communities, who have direct understanding of the kinds of barriers they are seeking to address. It's really important for this challenge that this kind of on-the-ground organising is rewarded, as it's what makes meaningful onboarding possible
f6_assessments.q1: Yes. The team is diverse, and has a really good set of skills and experience between them. The breakdown of  daily/weekly/monthly activities is clearly already working. Perhaps it would have been good to include a couple of milestones towards the 20% increased onboarding that they are aiming for, and how they might recalibrate if they find at the halfway point that it's not growing as they hoped; but this is not a huge issue, as they clearly *are* working in a very responsive way.  The budget is  clear, appropriate, and broken down to an appropriate level. I also like the approach of calculating full cost-recovery and then giving a "discount" – it is illuminating to see the real value of the work that's being done.
f6_assessments.q2: Yes. I think the approach of having one, simple, overall KPI (20% participation growth), that addresses the project's and the challenge's aims very directly, is a good one for this project. There are also several other means of auditing progress, and the team are particularly clear on their approach to financial reporting, and are taking a groundbreaking approach to it which could have longterm significance for Catalyst.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal continues an existing project which is an eastern hemisphere town hall. The proposal helps to onboard an underrepresented community and should increase catalyst participation and voting, thus meeting the challenge brief.
f6_assessments.q1: the team overlaps with Catalyst Swarm and School. They are already producing the eastern hemisphere town hall but seek a treasury to support costs and improve content. The Eastern Hemisphere town hall is already active and the team clearly has what it takes to keep evolving the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The treasury will be managed in a decentralized manner and all transactions reported. The requested total is based off 3 specific expense categories. The quantity requested is modest and is very likely to provide value to the ecosystem.

solution: Eastern TownHallは、イベントやコンテンツの翻訳などで東欧諸国を支援しています。ファンドごとに参加者を20％増やすことを目標としています。
experience: カタリスト・スワーム、イースタン・タウンホール、カタリスト・スクールの共同設立者。IT＆ソフトウェアエンジニアリング。東アジア＆日本の教育者、会計士。
